/-- Let `M` act continuously on an Râ‚ topological space `X`.

  borelize M

  exact isClosed_setOf_preimage_ae_eq f.curry.continuous (measurePreserving_smul Â· Î¼) _ hsm
    (measure_ne_top _ _)

`g` is an element of `M such that its natural multiples are dense in `M`,

    [MulAction M X] [ContinuousSMul M X] {g : M} (hg : DenseRange (g ^ Â· : â„• â†’ M))
    (Î¼ : Measure X) [IsFiniteMeasure Î¼] [Î¼.InnerRegular] [ErgodicSMul M X Î¼] :
    Ergodic (g â€¢ Â·) Î¼ := by

  refine aeconst_of_dense_setOf_preimage_smul_eq hsm.nullMeasurableSet (hg.mono ?_)
  refine range_subset_iff.2 fun n â†¦ ?_
  rw [mem_setOf, â† smul_iterate, preimage_iterate_eq, iterate_fixed hs]

name: DenseRange.zpow_of_ergodic_mul_left
initialProofState:
G : Type u_1
instâœâµ : Group G
instâœâ´ : TopologicalSpace G
instâœÂ³ : TopologicalGroup G
instâœÂ² : MeasurableSpace G
instâœÂ¹ : OpensMeasurableSpace G
Î¼ : MeasureTheory.Measure G
instâœ : Î¼.IsOpenPosMeasure
g : G
hg : Ergodic (fun x => HMul.hMul g x) Î¼
âŠ¢ DenseRange fun x => HPow.hPow g x
decl:
/-- If the left multiplication by `g` is ergodic
with respect to a measure which is positive on nonempty open sets,
then the integer powers of `g` are dense in `G`. -/
@[to_additive "If the left addition of `g` is ergodic
with respect to a measure which is positive on nonempty open sets,
then the integer multiples of `g` are dense in `G`."]
theorem DenseRange.zpow_of_ergodic_mul_left [OpensMeasurableSpace G]
    {Î¼ : Measure G} [Î¼.IsOpenPosMeasure] {g : G} (hg : Ergodic (g * Â·) Î¼) :
    DenseRange (g ^ Â· : â„¤ â†’ G) := by
  intro a
  by_contra h
  obtain âŸ¨V, hVâ‚, hVo, hVâŸ© :
      âˆƒ V : Set G, 1 âˆˆ V âˆ§ IsOpen V âˆ§ âˆ€ x âˆˆ V, âˆ€ y âˆˆ V, âˆ€ m : â„¤, g ^ m â‰  a * x / y := by
    rw [â† mem_compl_iff, â† interior_compl, mem_interior_iff_mem_nhds] at h
    have : Tendsto (fun (x, y) â†¦ a * x / y) (ğ“ 1) (ğ“ a) :=
      Continuous.tendsto' (by fun_prop) _ _ (by simp)
    rw [nhds_prod_eq] at this
    simpa [(nhds_basis_opens (1 : G)).prod_self.mem_iff, prod_subset_iff, and_assoc] using this h
  set s := â‹ƒ m : â„¤, g ^ m â€¢ V
  have hso : IsOpen s := isOpen_iUnion fun m â†¦ hVo.smul _
  have hsne : s.Nonempty := âŸ¨1, mem_iUnion.2 âŸ¨0, by simpaâŸ©âŸ©
  have hd : Disjoint s (a â€¢ V) := by
    simp_rw [s, disjoint_iUnion_left, disjoint_left]
    rintro m _ âŸ¨x, hx, rflâŸ© âŸ¨y, hy, hxyâŸ©
    apply hV y hy x hx m
    simp_all
  have hgs : (g * Â·) â»Â¹' s = s := by
    simp only [s, preimage_iUnion, â† smul_eq_mul, preimage_smul]
    refine iUnion_congr_of_surjective _ (add_left_surjective (-1)) fun m â†¦ ?_
    simp [zpow_add, mul_smul]
  cases hg.measure_self_or_compl_eq_zero hso.measurableSet hgs with
  | inl h => exact hso.measure_ne_zero _ hsne h
  | inr h =>

name: DenseRange.zsmul_of_ergodic_add_left
initialProofState:

/-- If the left multiplication by `g` is ergodic
with respect to a measure which is positive on nonempty open sets,
then the integer powers of `g` are dense in `G`. -/

with respect to a measure which is positive on nonempty open sets,
then the integer multiples of `g` are dense in `G`."]
theorem DenseRange.zpow_of_ergodic_mul_left [OpensMeasurableSpace G]
    {Î¼ : Measure G} [Î¼.IsOpenPosMeasure] {g : G} (hg : Ergodic (g * Â·) Î¼) :

  intro a
  by_contra h
  obtain âŸ¨V, hVâ‚, hVo, hVâŸ© :
      âˆƒ V : Set G, 1 âˆˆ V âˆ§ IsOpen V âˆ§ âˆ€ x âˆˆ V, âˆ€ y âˆˆ V, âˆ€ m : â„¤, g ^ m â‰  a * x / y := by
    rw [â† mem_compl_iff, â† interior_compl, mem_interior_iff_mem_nhds] at h

  have hsne : s.Nonempty := âŸ¨1, mem_iUnion.2 âŸ¨0, by simpaâŸ©âŸ©
  have hd : Disjoint s (a â€¢ V) := by
    simp_rw [s, disjoint_iUnion_left, disjoint_left]
    rintro m _ âŸ¨x, hx, rflâŸ© âŸ¨y, hy, hxyâŸ©
    apply hV y hy x hx m
    simp_all
  have hgs : (g * Â·) â»Â¹' s = s := by
    simp only [s, preimage_iUnion, â† smul_eq_mul, preimage_smul]
    refine iUnion_congr_of_surjective _ (add_left_surjective (-1)) fun m â†¦ ?_
    simp [zpow_add, mul_smul]
  cases hg.measure_self_or_compl_eq_zero hso.measurableSet hgs with
  | inl h => exact hso.measure_ne_zero _ hsne h
  | inr h =>
    refine (hVo.smul a).measure_ne_zero Î¼ (.image _ âŸ¨1, hVâ‚âŸ©) (measure_mono_null ?_ h)
